name: Cognitive Bias Training
description: Training to recognize, counteract, and neutralize cognitive biases that influence perception and decision-making in information analysis.

cards.title: Understanding Cognitive Biases
cards.description: An overview of how cognitive biases impact perception and decision-making.
bulletpoints: Defining cognitive bias and its psychological origins.
Recognizing how biases shape personal and collective belief systems.
Identifying key biases that influence intelligence analysis and decision-making.
cards.summaryText: Define core biases, trace their origins, and list the ones that most skew high-stakes analysis.

cards.title: Confirmation Bias & Echo Chambers
cards.description: Recognizing and neutralizing the tendency to seek out information that confirms existing beliefs.
bulletpoints: Understanding how social media algorithms reinforce confirmation bias.
Developing strategies to challenge assumptions through diverse information sources.
Breaking out of echo chambers using critical questioning techniques.
cards.summaryText: Expose algorithmic echo chambers, seek dissenting sources, and question assumptions until the loop breaks.

cards.title: Anchoring Bias & Narrative Framing
cards.description: Identifying how initial information influences subsequent judgments and decisions.
bulletpoints: Recognizing media framing tactics that manipulate public perception.
Using counter-framing strategies to neutralize manipulation.
Developing mental resilience against first-impression influence techniques.
cards.summaryText: Spot anchoring cues, reframe narratives, and train yourself to withhold judgment past the first impression.

cards.title: Availability Heuristic & Media Influence
cards.description: Understanding how easily recalled information skews risk perception and decision-making.
bulletpoints: Identifying how media coverage distorts statistical reality.
Applying probability-based thinking to counter availability bias.
Using mental exercises to assess risk based on data rather than fear-based narratives.
cards.summaryText: Compare headlines to hard data, run probability checks, and practice risk assessments grounded in stats.

cards.title: Groupthink & Mass Psychology
cards.description: Recognizing and resisting the pressure to conform to collective opinions.
bulletpoints: Identifying symptoms of groupthink in political, social, and corporate environments.
Developing independent critical thinking to counter mass conformity.
Building resilience against social manipulation tactics.
cards.summaryText: Diagnose groupthink signals, assert independent analysis, and build cultures that welcome dissent.

cards.title: Authority Bias & Deference to Power
cards.description: Understanding how perceived authority can distort judgment and decision-making.
bulletpoints: Recognizing how figures of authority exploit cognitive bias for control.
Differentiating between legitimate expertise and manufactured authority.
Training critical questioning techniques to challenge authoritative claims.
cards.summaryText: Scrutinize authority claims, separate expertise from theater, and question power with disciplined rigor.

cards.title: The Illusory Truth Effect
cards.description: Analyzing how repeated exposure to false information increases belief in its validity.
bulletpoints: Understanding how repetition embeds falsehoods into public consciousness.
Developing counter-strategies to disrupt false narrative reinforcement.
Utilizing counter-messaging tactics to deprogram misinformation.
cards.summaryText: Track repetition campaigns, interrupt them with factual counters, and reset audiences before lies embed.

cards.title: Survivorship Bias & Distorted Perspectives
cards.description: Recognizing how incomplete datasets lead to misinformed conclusions.
bulletpoints: Understanding how historical narratives are selectively framed.
Detecting missing variables in case studies, research, and intelligence analysis.
Using complete datasets to challenge survivorship distortion in media narratives.
cards.summaryText: Hunt for missing data, surface silent failures, and re-evaluate narratives using complete evidence.

cards.title: Overconfidence Bias & The Illusion of Knowledge
cards.description: Understanding how excessive self-assurance can lead to flawed decision-making.
bulletpoints: Recognizing how expertise can create blind spots in intelligence work.
Applying Socratic questioning to challenge overconfidence in conclusions.
Developing mental flexibility to adapt when presented with new evidence.
cards.summaryText: Check your own certainty, probe conclusions with Socratic tests, and pivot fast when new facts land.

cards.title: Cognitive Bias Countermeasures & Rational Thinking Frameworks
cards.description: Building cognitive resilience against bias-induced manipulation and decision errors.
bulletpoints: Applying structured analytical techniques to minimize bias in intelligence work.
Using Bayesian reasoning and probability assessments for decision-making.
Developing self-awareness techniques to maintain cognitive neutrality in analysis.
cards.summaryText: Apply structured analysis, lean on Bayesian updates, and keep self-awareness high to stay bias-resistant.
